channel.title: Comments on: What does the 'Favourite' function mean on Twitter?

item.title: By: â˜… Roger W Hancock â˜… PoetPatriot.com
item.dc:creator: â˜… Roger W Hancock â˜… PoetPatriot.com
item.description:
I never quite understood the value of 'favorite-ing' I can see the value of being able to view the 'favorite' posts later. I have preferred to be reTweeted, that my comment gets greater viewership. I have seen some Tweeters 'favorite' and reTweet. I am more so flattered when both are done. If someone is willing to favorite I would think they would also want to share it with their followers. I am a bit disappointed when they like my posts enough to 'favorite' but not to reTweet.
I have not 'favorite'd but have occasionally reTweeted. I should begin to do both, to reTweet to show appreciation for being followed and to 'favorite' to be able to find the most intriguing Tweets later.
item.content:encoded:
I never quite understood the value of ‘favorite-ing’ I can see the value of being able to view the ‘favorite’ posts later. I have preferred to be reTweeted, that my comment gets greater viewership.
I have seen some Tweeters ‘favorite’ and reTweet. I am more so flattered when both are done.
If someone is willing to favorite I would think they would also want to share it with their followers. I am a bit disappointed when they like my posts enough to ‘favorite’ but not to reTweet.

I have not ‘favorite’d but have occasionally reTweeted. I should begin to do both, to reTweet to show appreciation for being followed and to ‘favorite’ to be able to find the most intriguing Tweets later.

item.title: By: Results show that you’re clean, and also something about Twitter functionality | Green tea and Velociraptors
item.dc:creator: Results show that you’re clean, and also something about Twitter functionality | Green tea and Velociraptors
item.description: [...] and favouriting means on an anecdotal or personal level, but what about more generally. I set up a poll last week to gather data on what ‘favouriting’ a tweet means to different people. The [...]
item.content:encoded: […] and favouriting means on an anecdotal or personal level, but what about more generally. I set up a poll last week to gather data on what ‘favouriting’ a tweet means to different people. The […]

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/what-does-the-favourite-function-mean-on-twitter/#comment-305">Danya Hodgetts</a>.
Yep, I don't really get the bookmarking idea either, despite it's popularity! Seeing as how browsers can now handle hundred of tabs opening simultaneously, I just create a series of things to read/tweet during the day. It's like a non-stop recycling library! The best of those simply go into Chrome bookmarks, simples.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Danya Hodgetts.

Yep, I don’t really get the bookmarking idea either, despite it’s popularity! Seeing as how browsers can now handle hundred of tabs opening simultaneously, I just create a series of things to read/tweet during the day. It’s like a non-stop recycling library! The best of those simply go into Chrome bookmarks, simples.

item.title: By: Danya Hodgetts
item.dc:creator: Danya Hodgetts
item.description:
I don't favourite anything, because I found I wasn't going back to read them. If I want to read something, I forward it to my inbox so that everything's in one place.
I had never thought of it being like a "like", but that's a great idea. The tweet later one is good too, to save bursts of tweets. Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
I don’t favourite anything, because I found I wasn’t going back to read them. If I want to read something, I forward it to my inbox so that everything’s in one place.

I had never thought of it being like a “like”, but that’s a great idea. The tweet later one is good too, to save bursts of tweets. Thanks!

item.title: By: Naupaka
item.dc:creator: Naupaka
item.description: I use it as a quick way to trigger an IFTTT action to save the link in the tweet to my Pinboard.in account, with a tag so I know I need to get back to it later (plus I subscribe to Pinboard's archive feature, so the text from the linked page is scraped and archived in case the original site goes down/changes/etc). Makes it a lot easier to quickly note things for later reading without spending too much time during the first pass.
item.content:encoded: I use it as a quick way to trigger an IFTTT action to save the link in the tweet to my Pinboard.in account, with a tag so I know I need to get back to it later (plus I subscribe to Pinboard’s archive feature, so the text from the linked page is scraped and archived in case the original site goes down/changes/etc). Makes it a lot easier to quickly note things for later reading without spending too much time during the first pass.

item.title: By: Harvey
item.dc:creator: Harvey
item.description: As a bookmark, I suppose. Certainly because I'd like to keep it to look at in the future - for SCIENCE occasionally, or just for sentimental reasons :)
item.content:encoded: As a bookmark, I suppose. Certainly because I’d like to keep it to look at in the future – for SCIENCE occasionally, or just for sentimental reasons ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: 1kusogaki
item.dc:creator: 1kusogaki
item.description: As for me I use it a variety of ways, mostly as a bookmark though. I usually retweet things I agree with. I have a response from a celeb marked as a favorite, as it's nice to look back over, it wasn't worth retweeting though. Sometimes I might want to respond to a tweet but be busy at the time, so save it for later.
item.content:encoded: As for me I use it a variety of ways, mostly as a bookmark though. I usually retweet things I agree with. I have a response from a celeb marked as a favorite, as it’s nice to look back over, it wasn’t worth retweeting though. Sometimes I might want to respond to a tweet but be busy at the time, so save it for later.

item.title: By: Oliver Knevitt
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knevitt
item.description: I quite often use it in the same way as retweet, in that I like to use it to flatter the tweeter, but I don't necessarily want to clutter up my followers' timeline. Like, if a hashtag I'm following has a long series of jokes or something, it would piss off all my followers if I retweeted every one I found funny. But yeah, I mostly like it as an archiving tool for tweets that I found interesting.
item.content:encoded: I quite often use it in the same way as retweet, in that I like to use it to flatter the tweeter, but I don’t necessarily want to clutter up my followers’ timeline. Like, if a hashtag I’m following has a long series of jokes or something, it would piss off all my followers if I retweeted every one I found funny. But yeah, I mostly like it as an archiving tool for tweets that I found interesting.

item.title: By: bernard delacruz phd (@dubbio1)
item.dc:creator: bernard delacruz phd (@dubbio1)
item.description: I use it more as a bookmarking functions. Hootsuite makes it easy to set-up a feed of your favorites. I use the retweet function to spread the love and only retweet things I "agree" with. If I just want to read it later, I'll only bookmark.
item.content:encoded: I use it more as a bookmarking functions. Hootsuite makes it easy to set-up a feed of your favorites. I use the retweet function to spread the love and only retweet things I “agree” with. If I just want to read it later, I’ll only bookmark.

item.title: By: elyphaleth
item.dc:creator: elyphaleth
item.description: I often use it to bookmark something for when I have time to read it, also for when I agree with the tweet, or just because I like it.
item.content:encoded: I often use it to bookmark something for when I have time to read it, also for when I agree with the tweet, or just because I like it.
